If you want to keep the test and source files in the same source tree 
(I've used both and think I prefer it that way), then I *think* this 
will work:

<javadoc>
  <fileset dir="${src}">
    <exclude name="**/Test*.java"/>
  </fileset>
</javadoc>

We've got quite a number of sub-projects that keep test and source 
files in the same tree, but we generate the JavaDocs across multiple 
sub-projects (by copying all the javadoc-able sources to a temp 
directory and running javadoc on that), so our <fileset> is applied 
to a <copy> task, but it looks like the above should work as well..
